snippet: The effort to build a rebel force against the Islamic State failed in part because many rebels focused on a campaign against President Bashar al-Assad, officials said.
abstract: Pentagon and White House officials announce end to effort to create military force from Syrian rebels that could stand up to Islamic State; say $500 million effort was failure after admitting only few fighters had been trained; provide rough outline of new plan that will likely involve arming select rebel forces.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR, HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear and Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Helene Cooper from London. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The effort to build a rebel force against the Islamic State failed in part because many rebels focused on a campaign against President Bashar al-Assad, officials said.

headline.main: Obama Administration Ends Effort to Train Syrians to Combat ISIS
headline.print_headline: U.S. Ends Effort to Train Rebels in Syrian Fight

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
